content: Hi! I'm a beginner to Lean and to formal mathematics; I could not find an instance for no_zero_divisors for complex numbers, should it have one?
Hey! It should come for free from docs#Complex.instField. Can you show us something that you expect should work but doesn't?

Ah I see, I suspected it was along those lines; I had a bit of difficulty navigating that website and searching for instances (I tried Find-ing "no_zero_divisors" on the data.complex.basic page and in the search bar, and Find-ing "complex" on the page containing the instances for no_zero_divisors. Thanks for the tip. How did you know where to look?
I see you're saying no_zero_divisors - that's lean 3 syntax. Are you using lean 4?
Oh wow, I didn't realize but you're right. I was looking at mathlib3 documentation
My search engine gave me results pointing to mathlib3 documentation; that's something I should've been more wary about since this has happened to me before
Michael Lan has marked this topic as resolved.
